intro: Talpinaria sandemanii, commonly known as the Sandeman's talpinaria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy soils. Talpinaria sandemanii is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
